title: Factor the Perfect Square
text: Does the expression match any of these formats: $${\left(a x\right)}^2+2a b x$$ + $$b^2$$ $$=$$ $${\left(a x+b\right)}^2$$, $${\left(a x\right)}^2-2a b x+b^2$$ $$=$$ $${\left(a x-b\right)}^2$$ ? Yes.

title: Factor the Perfect Square
text: In this case, we can see that $$16n^2+40n+25$$ as $${\left(a x\right)}^2+2a b x+b^2={\left(ax+b\right)}^2$$ where $$ax=4n$$ and $$b=5$$. We can factor $$16n^2+40n+25$$ as $${\left(4n+5\right)}^2$$.
speech: In this case, we can see that  16 n squared, plus 40 n plus, 25  as , parentheses a x  squared plus, 2 a b x, plus b squared is equal to parentheses, a x plus b,  squared  where  a x is equal to, 4 n  and  b, is equal to 5 . We can factor  16 n squared plus 40 n plus 25  as , parentheses, 4 n plus 5,  squared .

title: Rewrite the Equation
speech: We can rewrite  16 n squared, plus 40 n plus 25 is equal to 4  as , parentheses, 4 n plus 5,  squared is equal to 4 .

title: Use Square Root Property
text: The square root property: if $$x^2$$ $$=$$ k, then $$x$$ $$=$$ $$\sqrt{k}$$, or $$x$$ $$=$$ $$-\sqrt{k}$$, or $$x$$ $$=\sqrt{k}$$. $${\left(4n+5\right)}^2=4$$, we can take square root both sides and get $$4n+5=-2$$ or $$4n+5=2$$.

title: Final Answer
text: Therefore, $$16n^2+40n+25=4$$ has two solutions which are $$n=\frac{-7}{4}$$ and $$n=\frac{-3}{4}$$.
speech: Therefore,  16 n squared, plus 40 n plus 25 is equal to 4  has two solutions which are  n, is equal to fraction, negative 7, over 4,   and  n is equal to, fraction, negative 3, over 4,  .
